key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 25% of OTA prices were higher than the website last week, indicating increased costs for consumers.
51.05% of MSE channel prices were lower than the airlineâ€™s website, demonstrating strong competitiveness.
The GDS channel exhibited higher prices 50.79% of the time compared to the airline's website, suggesting a need for strategic adjustments.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: More than 25% of OTA channel pricing records for Korean Air were listed higher than airline website prices last week.
Notably, the percentage of offers unavailable on the OTA channel increased by 2.4% from the previous week, indicating less competitive availability.
The proportion of prices identical to those on the airline's website remained consistent across the last week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA channel prices were higher than the website for over 25% of records last week. This reflects a difficult pricing environment for consumers.
The percentage of unavailable pricing options increased slightly from the previous week, suggesting decreased competitiveness in the OTA channel.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: In the KR origin region, the OTA channel recorded higher prices 31.2% of the time last week, further complicating consumer choice.
Non-KR regions showed stable identical pricing compared to the website, with minimal fluctuation from previous periods.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the KR point of origin, 31.1% of prices were found higher on the OTA than on the website, reflecting further anomalies in pricing.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Non-KR Slight Increase in Same Pricing
ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Pricing in the Non-KR point of origin saw a slight increase in identical prices, suggesting more competitive dynamics.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, OTA channel prices were higher 13.4% of the time last week, indicating potential for savings on earlier bookings.
The far-out booking window maintained a steady pricing state with consistent same prices as last week.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 51.05% of prices in the MSE channel were lower than the airline's website, highlighting competitive pricing.
Only 0.22% of the MSE offers were higher than the airline's prices last week, indicating a rare occurrence of premium pricing.
Approximately 47.08% of MSE offers matched the airline's website prices in the latest week, reflecting a strong alignment with the airline's pricing strategy.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Compared to the previous week, the percentage of MSE offers labeled as 'Lower' increased by 3.90%, reinforcing pricing competitiveness.
The average price difference remained minor, with a 0.14% increase in the latest week, largely stable across historical dimensions.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: In short-haul routes, 47.45% of MSE offers were lower than website prices, driving high volume sales and better market penetration.
All long-haul offers through MSE were lower than those on the airline website, suggesting favorable pricing strategy for these routes.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For origin country KR, 35.09% of offers in the MSE channel were lower than the airline's own site, showcasing competitive local pricing.
A significant 96.40% of Non-KR offers were lower, indicating a strategy to attract price-sensitive customers from international markets.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings exhibited a strong 49.67% of MSE options priced lower than those on the website, appealing to last-minute travelers.
For far-out bookings, 53.51% were lower than the airline's own pricing, indicating efforts to fill advanced bookings competently.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel exhibited a higher pricing status 50.79% of the time in the latest week, indicating a persistent trend of elevated prices compared to the airline's website.
In the short haul segment, 54.49% of the time, GDS pricing was higher than the airline's website, reinforcing the need for competitive pricing strategies in this segment.
The same pricing status was observed in 44.38% of cases across all dimensions in the latest week, maintaining a stable offer alignment with the website.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, the GDS channel prices were higher than the website in over half (50.79%) of analyzed itineraries.
44.38% of the itineraries had the same price as the airline's website, suggesting a stable alignment.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: All short haul itineraries indicated GDS pricing was higher in 54.49% of the cases, signaling a crucial area for pricing adjustments.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For itineraries originating in KR, GDS pricing was higher 62.80% of the time, presenting a competitive challenge.
The Non-KR point of origin showed a same pricing status in 83.66% of itineraries, reflecting consistent pricing alignment.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In the close-in booking window, GDS prices were higher 51.27% of the time, indicating pricing pressure on last-minute bookings.
GDS pricing was higher for far out bookings in 50% of cases, suggesting potential optimization opportunities for future travelers.
